result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
State by Gruenke / Def in custody w/ Atty M. Davis
Davis:  we will stipulate to the Dr's report & its findings
State: we agree w/ report
CRT finds the def is not competent at this time but may regain competency
CRT will sign Order once provided 
Same bond & conditions to remain
Meredith Davis

Atty Davis - He qualifies for a PD, haven't had a chance to talk to him.
Court: Talk to him, see what his position is.
Calendar Call: 12-11-15 at 1:30pm w/EML
Same bond to continue

State - Comp report came back, we agree with the report
Def - I accept that I am not competent
Court: Attorney to be appointed by the PD's Office.
Calendar Call: 12-07-15 at 1:30pm w/EML
Cash bond to continue
filed

Def in custody
Gruenke: at last hearing said wanted to plead guilty & avoid trial, just talked to him - seems to be competed but now today he says he wants to have the original modus which I assume is trial
Brown: that is correct will not enter plea
CRT: going to ask that def be evaluated for competency
CRT: take off trial calendar & going to ask for Forensic people to come & do an eval and if they find you are competent then Mr Gruenke can offer you an Alford Plea
CRT: remove from trial calendar & Mr Gruenke to prepare order - get new date
FOR Competency Exam by DHS - signed by RAG
Competency hearing at 12-04-2015 01:30 pm

Def in custody w/o counsel
Gruenke: def doesn't want representation - have concerns of his mental health - have questions of his competency to proceed
CRT: there is a potential here for NG by reason of mental disease or defect. Will you agree to comp eval?
Def: no, I don't want my esteem changed
CRT: so you're saying you'd rather be in prison than talk to a psychologist
Def: that's right - willing to plead guilty
Gruenke: still want to raise comp - have concerns given his stmts.
CRT: Mr Brown, I cannot take your guilty plea unless I'm satisfied you're giving your plea FVI & I can't make that determination if I'm uncomfortable w/your mental state - so we're at a crossroads here - I can order an eval for comp - you are rejecting the NG by reason of mental disease/defect
Gruenke: if you give me another date I can talk to his PO & Mr Josephson & can talk to him in jail again.
Def: rev hearing 11/4
CRT: I'll give you until that time - leave on trial calendar

Final pre-trial at 11-19-2015 09:00 am.
Jury selection at 12-14-2015 08:45 am.
Jury trial at 12-15-2015 08:45 am.
